fields.fieldDescription: The Record ID (RID) uniquely identifying this cashflow item.
The amount of the cashflow.
The amount of the cashflow that has already been matched (to an Incoming Money Transfer or WIP).
The amount of the cashflow representing principal.
The amount of the cashflow representing fees (other than late fees).
The amount of the cashflow representing interest.
"When the Customer involved in the cashflow is a Borrower or Agent,  indicates whether the Customer is the Borrower or is the Agent."

The Branch of the cashflow.  (All cashflows are between a Customer and a Host Bank Branch).  The cashflow items for a particular Branch are segregated on the tab list by Branch and appear underneath the relevant Branch Code and Branch Name.
"The code identifying the ""Business Transaction"" or the ""Accounting Transaction Code"" associated with the cashflow."
The currency code for the cashflow.
The Record ID (RID) of the customer involved in the cashflow.
The Record ID (RID) for the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow.
"The Record ID (RID) of the Customer's Servicing Group.  The Servicing Group Name, Alias and Location are displayed in the Cashflow tab list."
The Record ID (RID) for the transaction which created this cashflow record.
The code identifying the type of transaction with which the cashflow is associated.
"Indicates the direction of the cashflow (""To the Customer"" from the host bank branch or ""From the Customer"" to the host bank branch)."
Timestamp from when this row was created.
Timestamp from when this row was last updated.
User ID that created this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
User ID that last updated this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
The priority code for the cashflow.
Indicates whether or not the amount of the cashflow floats with pre-release changes to the shares of its transactions.
Indicates whether or not the customer involved in the cashflow is an SBLC Beneficiary.
"The amount of the cashflow that, when matched to an Incoming Money Transfer or WIP, was offset against Over and Short."
"Represents the current status of the cashflow. E.g., Do at release, partially done, done, etc."
The expense code for the cashflow.
The beneficiary account number obtained from the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow.
The beneficiary type obtained from the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow.
The CHIPS User ID obtained from the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow.
The Account Name obtained from the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow.
The division obtained from the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow.
The payment method obtained from the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow.
"The cash account number referenced in the cashflow (obtained from a lookup into the Cash Account Table for a specific combination of branch, processing area and currency)."
The Record ID (RID) for the deal.  (Corresponding deal name is displayed at the top of the Cashflow screen)
The Record ID (RID) for the facility.  (Corresponding facility name is displayed at the top of the Cashflow screen)
The Record ID (RID) for the participation agreement associated with the cashflow (if any).
"The ABA number, CHIPS number, DDA account number or book transfer account number obtained from the remittance instruction associated with the cashflow."

"The Record ID (RID) of the child transaction associated with the cashflow.  (Cashflows associated with group transactions reference not only their group transaction RID (CFL_RID_TRANS) but also the RID of the specific ""child"" or ""sub"" tran"
"The Record ID (RID) of the cashflow template associated with this transaction.  (Manual G/L and Manual Cashflow transactions store their data in a ""cashflow template"" until release)."
The target date for when this cashflow is to be released.

Cashflows with no parent point to themselves. Cashflows which have been split from another cashflow point to the rid of the cashflow from which they were split. For cashflows between host branches, there are two cashflows - for contractual, the one for non-main servicing group branch points to the one for the main servicing group branch; for participations, the one for the buyer branch points to the one for the seller branch.
"Relevant payment reference data obtained from the remittance instruction associated with this cashflow (such as the Beneficiary Information, the Bank to Bank Information, etc.)"
"The comment text required for a cashflow utilizing the ""CK"" or ""IDTS"" payment method.  (The relevant check number or IDTS routing information should appear in the comment).."
The amount of the cashflow representing late fees.
The amount of the cashflow representing escrow.
applicable only to cashflows with DDA remittance instructions
applicable only to completed cashflows with ACH remittance instructions. Y = savings account. N (or null) indicates checking account
